article.headline: Columbia 95, UC Davis 90
article.story: DURHAM, N.C. (AP) -- John Baumann had 29 points and 10 rebounds to lead Columbia past UC Davis 95-90 in a consolation game in the CBE Classic on Monday night. Brett Loscalzo added 18 points for the Lions (1-1), who lost to No. 11 Duke on Sunday in the tournament's Durham Regional. Columbia shot 49 percent for the game, including 10-for-20 from 3-point range, and hit 19 of 23 free throws after the break to erase a five-point deficit. Vince Oliver scored 26 points to lead UC Davis (0-2), which lost to Georgia Southern 116-73 on Sunday. The Aggies led by 12 in the first half and 46-41 at halftime before the Lions made a run and took a 12-point lead midway through the second half. UC Davis hung around and got as close as 82-81 on a layup by Oliver with 2:49 left, but Columbia answered with a 3-pointer from Mack Montgomery to stay in front.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
